title: Mastering Information Retrieval Through Real-World Analogies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience in academic literature search and proficiency in using digital devices
context.additional_context: Simultaneously emphasizing information retrieval competencies required in social science research methodologies and practical information utilization skills for job preparation

learning_goals: Learners can connect real-life cases (e.g., online shopping searches, job material collection) with information search strategies to explain at least three core search techniques
Learners can comparatively analyze the differences between academic databases and general search engines using analogical case studies
Learners can explain the processes of keyword selection, Boolean operator utilization, and search result evaluation in relation to real-life problem-solving
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
